title: Get Jacked
content:
# Get Jacked

## What

For this project, my goal is get jacked. Specifically, I want to be at around 12% body fat, which means I would need to weigh around 170 lbs.

## Why

**Personal Challenge**: I was an obese kid growing up (at 13 years old, I was ~5'6 and 220 lbs). Since then, I've been conscious of my health and the impact that aesthetics have on my confidence and how others perceive me. Back then, I would have thought getting a 6-pack is _theoretically possible_, but I cannot imagine it on me.

**Health**: I believe it is optimal to be at the 10-15% body fat range for longevity, energy, and general health. I also have asthma, and I've noticed that as my body fat decreases, the amount of asthma attacks I get also decreases.

## How

- I'm going on a [[whole-food-plant-based-diet-for-30-days | whole food plant based diet]] which I suppose will allow me to lose weight.
- I'm _not_ going to do anything unsustainable (multi-day fasting, excessive cardio, etc). I want to be able to maintain this lifestyle long term.
- I will lose ~1-2 lbs per week, and I will do strength training 3 times a week (Monday, Wednesday, Friday) to maintain muscle and do light cardio (walking, biking) on the other days.
- If I do not lose weight after 1 week, I will track my calories for 3 days to get a better estimate of how much I am eating.
- I will do intermittent fasting (16:8)

## When

If I lose 1 lb per week, I will reach my goal in 13 weeks, which is January 13th, 2026.

## Progress

- 183 lbs as of 2025-10-14

## Media

## Reflection

## Who Else

title: Knowledge Management System
description: A system I’m building to grow, organize, and express my knowledge over the next decade.
content:
# Knowledge Management System

## What

For this project, I’m building my own knowledge management system. I want something deeply integrated into my workflows and my other systems. It is inspired by the idea of a "second brain". I want to:

- Be capable of capturing anything (text, images, links, audio, video) on any device. Sync everything so that it is accessible from any device.
- Organize my information, having intelligent search and filters
- Easily express my knowledge through writing, projects, and my website.
- Constantly learn and remember what I've learned

## Why

A lot of my value comes from how I process information and make connections.  
Augmenting this will directly increase the value I can provide, which leads to a better quality of life [[so-good-they-cant-ignore-you]].
There is nostalgic value in preserving my thoughts and ideas over time.
From the perspective of AI, if I capture everything into my second brain, then I can leverage AI much more than someone who doesn't.

## How

I’m starting with my laptop since that’s where I spend most of my time and consume most of my information.
I’ll build small tools that can run locally — first to capture, then to organize, then to distill, and finally to express.
Because I already tag everything, I can make it programmatic — for example:

- If something is tagged `todo`, it can automatically sync to Taskwarrior.
- If it’s tagged `reading-list`, it can go into my RSS feed.

Eventually, I’ll connect it to my website so that some parts of my second brain can be accessed publicly.

## When

I will build an end-to-end MVP running by December 31st 2025.

## Progress

- [x] Built initial capture prototype — [GitHub Repo](https://github.com/MattHandzel/KnowledgeManagementSystem/)
- [x] Build local tagging + metadata indexing
- [ ] Integrate AI for tagging
- [ ] Integrate AI for summarization
- [ ] Create interface for organizing it within Neovim

## Media

- [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/MattHandzel/KnowledgeManagementSystem/)

## Reflection

## Who Else

Inspired by Tiago Forte, Nick Milo, and the PKM community.  
Also influenced by developers building open, local-first knowledge systems.

title: Longevity Biotech Fellowship
description: 10 week fellowship to make tangible personal progress in the field of longevity biotechnology.
content:
## What

"The Longevity Biotech Fellowship (LBF) is a community of hardcore Longevity Accelerationists. Our members build, join, and invest in revolutionary biotechnology projects for radical life extension." The LBF had a kickoff in Cofrentes, Spain on September 22nd, 2025. The fellowship is a ten-week program aimed at making tangible _personal_ progress in the field of longevity biotechnology with a personal demo day on December 14th, 2025.

For this fellowship, my goal is to:

- Solve a real problem for at least 1 person in the LBF. Supporting scientists, CEOs, improving their {creativity, productivity, searching, exploring, networking}.

## Why

I joined the LBF because I want to spend my life working on something that has high impact for a lot of people. Aging impacts everyone on a personal level, and it impacts society as a whole, so I want to explore if solving problems in the realm of longevity is my Ikigai. My specific goal of solving a problem for at least one person is I want to improve my agency, and learn how to make something that others want. I also believe at my current skillset, I cannot solve the "hard" problems, but I can do a support those that are solving the hard problems.

## How

By reaching out to people who I've met at LBF7 or in the Slack, ask them what problems they have that I am capable of solving and is aligned with my studies.
Draft up a project proposal and share it with whomever I am working with to get feedback and iterate on it.
Spend no more than 3 hours per week working on this project, as I have other commitments (university, job search, etc).
Have Scrum-like sprints once I have the MVP

## When

Make a MVP to solve their problem by November 2nd, 2025
Have 4 rounds of iteration and feedback by December 7th, 2025
Post the finished project by December 14th, 2025

## Progress

- [x] Post this “mission/goal” on the LBF Slack to “find” problems.
- [x] Reach out to those that have a company or are doing interesting work in the LBF Slack
- [x] Message 5 people to solicit for problems they have/project ideas
- [ ] Compile all of the "user interviews" I've conducted into a document
- [ ] Brainstorm solutions for these people's problems
- [ ] Write a project proposal for a maximum of 1 hour
- [ ] Send it to stakeholders

## Media

## Reflection

I've noticed I have a fear of asking people to help them. This is quite irrational as I am trying to help them, but I think it stems from a fear of failure.

## Who Else

title: Whole Food Plant Based Diet For 30 Days
content:
# Whole Food Plant Based Diet for 30 Days

## What

For 30 days I will be moving towards eating a whole food plant based diet based on [[how-not-to-die|How Not to Die]]. This means I will make an effort to remove the following from my diet:

- Meat
- Dairy
- Processed food
- Added sugar
- Oils

I will not be perfect. I will allow myself to eat some processed food like Huel[^1] and I might purchase something I didn't know had added sugar but I will be eating more and more pure as this month continues.

## Why

I want to see what effect having a very "clean" diet will have on my health, energy, and mood.
I want to experience everything there is to experience in life. Now when someone tells me they are vegan or vegetarian, we can bond over this shared experience.

## How

I will not buy anything that is not whole food plant based. I tend not to eat out already.
If I feel a negative difference in mood, health, and energy then I will stop this experiment.
I will take a multi-vitamin daily to get B12 and eat a lot of lentils, almonds, soy milk, and broccoli to maintain calcium.
If I am out with friends and there is nothing I can eat, I will eat what is available. I will not sacrifice social time for this diet.

## When

From 2025-10-15 to 2025-11-14 I will maintain this diet.

## Media

## Reflection

I did not realize that lentils actually taste very good! Tofu tastes good with soy sauce.
I think a hard part about this diet is getting over the belief that meat needs to be a part of every meal.
I also didn't know some foods like edameme have a good protein carb ratio.
It's only 1 day in and it seems quite easy to eat like this.
The only thing I am worried about is maintaining my muscle as I lose weight.
I've learned how to cook new dishes, which maintains novelty, which is a good reason to do these challenges!

## Who Else

I have tricked my roommate to doing a two-week vegetarian challenge.

[^1]: I have ~150$ worth of Huel that I need to eat before the end of the year. I might not always have time to cook.

aliases: Whole Food Plant Based Diet for 30 Days
